title: Calculation of results for uranium in water by alpha spectrometry

author: Marko Štrok, Reaktorski center, Institut "Jožef Stefan"

segmentation: Hello, my name is Marco and in this part you will learn how to calculate results for determination of rhenium in water samples by Alpha spectrometry.
As a result of measurements we have uranium spectrum with either tops or anium to trait or any am 235 or any am 234 and or anium 232.
William 232 is used as a tracer for tracing radiochemical recovery.
Uranium 238 and Radium 234 are from the same decade chain and are in this case in equilibrium becausw.
Both Pixar similar various or any AM 235 is from the other decade chain and its peak is very small.
For the calculation of the results, we will need to pick area or number of events recorded in each peak, since that correspond to the activity concentration of each radium client of interest results.
Uranium 2 trait activity concentration in water samples can be calculated using this simple equation 1.
Equation is the same if you are interested in uranium 235 or anium 234 activity concentration.
Just we have to replace number of counts with appropriate ones.
In the equation we have on top background, subtracted terranium to trade count rate.

Which we multiply by the uranium to two activity concentration which is known from all standard and then we divide it by the background subtracted uranium 232 count rate, mass of edit uranium 222 standard and volume of the sample.
Count rate is calculated with the equation 2 by division of number of counts, that is number of events in the peak area for specific radionuclide divided by measurement time.
For each of the results we have to calculate measurement uncertainties using can certainty, propagation loss.

Each of the element in equation 1 used to calculate or measurement have an uncertain T. In Equation 3, first term in brackets is showing creative standard uncertainties of background, subtracted rhenium to trade count rate.
Second term relative standard uncertainty of background subtracted.
Terranium 232 count rate.
3rd relative standard uncertainty of activity concentration of uranium.

2 Tracer next is relative standard uncertainty of mass of added tracer and the last one is relative standard uncertainty of volume of the sample standard uncertainties of background subtracted count rates can be calculated using equations.
Four and five were standard uncertainty of the count rate is calculated as poison distribution as one divided by the square root.
Of number of counts as shown in equation 6.
Standard and certainty for anium 232 tracer we can get from the certificate accompanying this tracer where standards and certainty of the mass and volumes depend.
Unused balance and volume measuring cylinder.
When we report results, we usually multiply combined standard uncertainty by the coverage factor to get expanded uncertainty as shown in equation CERN.
Usually we take coverage factor of two, which represents that there is 95% probability that the true value lies within or measured value plus minus expanded uncertainty.
Finally, we report our results as activity concentration plus minus expanded uncertainty.
We also have to provide each coverage factor we used.
